question_text: Has the Environmental Statement (Form V) for the financial year ending 31st March been submitted to the State Pollution Control Board on or before September 30th?
applicability_criteria: Every person carrying on an industry, operation or process requiring consent under Section 25 of the Water Act or Section 21 of the Air Act or authorization under Hazardous Wastes Rules[cite: 377].
legal_text: Every person... shall submit an environmental audit report for the financial year ending the 31st March in Form V to the concerned State Pollution Control Board on or before the 30th day of September every year[cite: 377].

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the 'Environmental Audit Report' (Form V) for the most recent financial year.
Step 2: Check Part A (Item 5) for the 'Date of last environmental statement' to ensure continuity[cite: 484].
Step 3: Verify Part B mentions 'Water Consumption' per unit of product[cite: 3].
Step 4: Verify Part C documents 'Percentage of variation from prescribed standards'[cite: 3].
Step 5: Confirm the submission receipt date is on or before September 30th.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the full PDF of the 'Environmental Audit Report for the Financial year ending the 31st March'. Ensure the filing date and Part C (Pollution Generated) are clearly visible.
capture_instructions.title: Evidence Requirement

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify if the document is 'Form V'. Check for keywords 'Environmental Audit Report', 'Part - A', and 'Water Consumption'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: 1. Extract the submission date and compare with 'September 30th'. 2. In 'Part C', extract 'Percentage of variation'. If variation > 0%, flag for 'Reason' check. 3. Extract 'Water Consumption per unit' from Part B.

question_text: Was the 'Notice of intention to have sample analysed' (Form I) served 'then and there' on the occupier at the time of sampling?
applicability_criteria: When samples of air, water, soil or other substances are taken for analysis from any factory or premises under Section 11.
legal_text: The Central Government or the officer empowered shall serve on the occupier or his agent or person in charge of the place a notice then and there in Form I of his intention to have the sample analyzed. [cite: 325]

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the signed copy of 'Form I' issued during the specific sampling event.
Step 2: Verify the 'Date', 'Time', and specific 'Place' where the sample was taken are recorded. [cite: 3]
Step 3: Confirm the acknowledgement signature of the Occupier/Agent is present to prove service.

capture_instructions.document_name: FORM I Notice of intention to have sample analysed
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the full PDF of Form I. Ensure the 'Time', 'Place', and Occupier's acknowledgement signature are clearly visible.
capture_instructions.title: Evidence Requirement

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify if document is 'Form I'. Check for keywords 'Notice of intention to have sample analysed', 'rule 7', and 'specific place'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: 1. Extract 'Date', 'Time', and 'Place' of sampling. 2. Verify if the 'Signature' of the occupier/agent is detected at the bottom. 3. Flag if the Date field is blank.

question_text: Was the sample sent to the Government Analyst accompanied by the 'Memorandum to Government Analyst' (Form II) describing the seal and marks?
applicability_criteria: Mandatory when submitting any sample portion to the environmental laboratory for analysis.
legal_text: Sample taken for analysis shall be sent by the Central Government or the officer empowered to the environmental laboratory by registered post or through special messenger along with Form II. [cite: 327]

inspection_steps: Step 1: Locate the copy of 'Form II' that accompanied the lab sample.
Step 2: Verify the field 'The portion of the sample has been marked by me with the following mark'. [cite: 425]
Step 3: Ensure the 'Details of the portion of sample taken' matches the description in Form I. [cite: 426]
Step 4: Confirm the document bears the officer's SEAL. [cite: 429]

capture_instructions.document_name: FORM II MEMORANDUM TO GOVERNMENT ANALYST
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the scanned copy of Form II. Ensure the 'Details of the portion of sample' and the Officer's Seal are legible.
capture_instructions.title: Evidence Requirement

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify if document is 'Form II'. Check for keywords 'MEMORANDUM TO GOVERNMENT ANALYST' and 'rule 8'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: 1. Extract the text under 'Details of the portion of sample taken'. 2. Extract the text under 'The portion of the sample has been marked by me with the following mark'. 3. Verify presence of 'SEAL' impression.

question_text: Does the 'Report by Government Analyst' (Form III) certify that the sample seals and fastening were intact and matched the officer's specimen impression upon receipt?
applicability_criteria: Mandatory for all samples analyzed by an environmental laboratory under Section 11 to ensure admissibility of evidence.
legal_text: The findings shall be recorded in Form III in triplicate and signed by the Government Analyst... Check the condition of seals and fastening upon receipt by the lab[cite: 3, 329].

inspection_steps: Step 1: Retrieve 'Form III' (Report by Govt. Analyst) returned by the laboratory.
Step 2: Locate Item 2: 'The Condition of seals, fastening of sample on receipt was as follows'.
Step 3: Verify the analyst has explicitly written that seals were 'intact' or 'matched' the specimen.
Step 4: Ensure the report is signed by the Government Analyst.

capture_instructions.document_name: FORM III REPORT BY GOVERNMENT ANALYST
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the full PDF of Form III. Ensure Item 2 regarding 'Condition of seals' is clearly legible.
capture_instructions.title: Evidence Requirement

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify if document is 'Form III'. Check for keywords 'REPORT BY GOVERNMENT ANALYST', 'Condition of seals', and 'Rule 8'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: 1. Extract the text under 'The Condition of seals, fastening of sample on receipt was as follows'. 2. Logic: If text contains 'Intact', 'Ok', or 'Matched', pass. If text contains 'Broken', 'Tampered', or 'Did not match', flag as RISK.

question_text: Do the analysis results declared in Form III fall within the prescribed standards for the specific industry or pollutant?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to industries discharging environmental pollutants (Section 7).
legal_text: I further certify that I have analysed the aforementioned sample... and declare the result of the analysis to be as follows[cite: 445, 446].

inspection_steps: Step 1: Review the main body of 'Form III' under the declaration of results.
Step 2: Compare the 'Result' values against the specific standards (e.g., BOD, COD, pH) mentioned in the Consent to Operate or Schedules.
Step 3: Check if the analyst has noted any method of analysis that differs from standard protocols.

capture_instructions.document_name: FORM III REPORT BY GOVERNMENT ANALYST
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the full PDF of Form III. Ensure the table or list showing 'Result of analysis' is completely visible.
capture_instructions.title: Evidence Requirement

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify if document is 'Form III'. Check for keywords 'declare the result of the analysis', 'Government Analyst'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: 1. Extract the list of parameters and their corresponding numeric values from the results section. 2. Present extracted values for manual comparison against Schedule I-IV standards (as standards vary by industry).

question_text: Has the 'Form of Notice' (Form IV) been served to the Central Government or authorized authority at least 60 days prior to filing the complaint?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to any person (citizen or entity) intending to file a complaint for an offence under the Act.
legal_text: No court shall take cognizance... except on a complaint made by... any person who has given notice of not less than sixty days, in the manner prescribed... [Notice shall be in Form IV].

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the copy of 'Form IV' (Notice under section 19(b)) relating to the complaint.
Step 2: Check the 'Date' at the bottom of the form.
Step 3: Calculate if 60 days have passed between this Notice Date and the Complaint Filing Date.
Step 4: Verify the notice lists specific 'documentary evidence' (photos/reports) in the support section.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the full PDF of Form IV. Ensure the 'Date' and the section listing 'enclosed documents' are clearly visible.
capture_instructions.title: Evidence Requirement

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify if document is 'Form IV'. Check for keywords 'Notice under section 19(b)', 'intention to file a complaint', and '60 days'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: 1. Extract the 'Dated' field at the bottom. 2. Extract the text following 'In support of my/our notice, I am /we are enclosed the following documents'. 3. Logic: If 'Dated' is null OR 'documents' section is empty, flag as Incomplete.

question_text: Is there proof that Form IV was sent via 'Registered Post Acknowledgement Due' as required by Rule 11(3)?
applicability_criteria: Mandatory procedural requirement for serving notice under Section 19(b).
legal_text: The notice shall be sent by registered post acknowledgement due.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Look for the 'Registered Post' receipt or the 'Acknowledgement Due' card attached to the office copy of Form IV.
Step 2: Verify the date on the postal receipt matches or is immediately after the date on Form IV.
Step 3: Ensure the recipient address matches the Authority designated in Rule 11(2).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the Postal Receipt or Acknowledgement Card associated with the Form IV submission.
capture_instructions.title: Service Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for 'Postal Receipt', 'India Post', or 'Acknowledgement Due' keywords.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Date' and 'Receiver Address'. Logic: Confirm date aligns with Form IV date.

question_text: Does the Environmental Statement (Form V) include a complete disclosure of Hazardous Wastes generated during the financial year in 'Part D'?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to industries handling hazardous substances or generating hazardous wastes as defined under the Hazardous Wastes (Management & Handling) Rules[cite: 377].
legal_text: Persons handling hazardous substances to comply with procedural safeguards... Environmental Audit Report... Part D [as specified under Hazardous Wastes (Management & Handling) Rules, 1989][cite: 50, 486].

inspection_steps: Step 1: Open the submitted 'Environmental Audit Report' (Form V).
Step 2: Navigate to 'PART - D'.
Step 3: Verify entries for 'Total Quantity (in Kg)' under two columns: 'During the previous financial year' and 'During the current financial year'.
Step 4: Check if wastes are categorized by 'From Process' and 'From Pollution Control Facilities'[cite: 486].

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the page containing 'PART - D' of Form V. Ensure the table showing 'Hazardous Wastes' and 'Total Quantity' is clearly visible.
capture_instructions.title: Evidence Requirement

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify if document contains 'PART - D' and 'Hazardous Wastes'. Check for table headers 'Total Quantity' and 'From Process'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: 1. Extract values for 'From Process' (Current Year) and 'From Pollution Control Facilities' (Current Year). 2. Logic: If both values are 0 or Blank, flag for verification (unless the industry claims Zero Liquid Discharge/No Haz Waste). 3. Extract 'Part - F' content if available to cross-reference disposal practice.

question_text: Are hazardous substances being handled (stored, packaged, transported) in accordance with the prescribed procedural safeguards?
applicability_criteria: Any person who handles (manufactures, processes, packages, stores, transports) hazardous substances[cite: 142].
legal_text: No person shall handle or cause to be handled any hazardous substance except in accordance with such procedure and after complying with such safeguards as may be prescribed[cite: 142].

inspection_steps: Step 1: Visit the storage/handling area.
Step 2: Verify if the 'Disposal practice adopted' matches the declaration in 'PART - F' of Form V[cite: 486].
Step 3: Observe if containers are properly sealed and labeled to prevent accidents (Section 8 mandate).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a photo of the hazardous waste storage area OR the 'PART - F' declaration page from Form V describing the characteristics and disposal practice.
capture_instructions.title: Site Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for 'PART - F' or image of 'Storage Containers' / 'Labels'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: If document is Form V Part F: Extract 'characteristics' and 'disposal practice adopted'. If Image: Detect presence of 'Hazard Labels' or 'Sealed Containers'.
